senses.sense_definition: The philosophical beliefs and doctrines associated with George Berkeley, particularly the view that material objects exist only as perceptions in the mind.

examples.text: The professor introduced <w>Berkeleianism</w> to the class by asking if a tree falling in the woods makes a sound if no one is there.
She wrote a detailed essay on the principles of <w>Berkeleianism</w> and its impact on modern metaphysics.
